result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph James Kozlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $13,368.00 payable to Jeff P.; and $1,400.00 to Michael P. and Catherine S. or civil judment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable. Payable first during probation and then explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Pay all applicable costs, surcharges, restitution and supervision fees by 10/19/2017 or civil judgment will be entered.
The Court ordered all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

Bail Refund Check Packet
Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Joseph James Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: MARK W.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 (THREE) YEARS, with credit for 0 (ZERO) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 (EIGHTEEN) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 (EIGHTEEN) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 (TWO) YEARS.  CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 DAYS (THIRTY), CONCURRENT to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to JEFF P. for $13,368.00 AND $1,400.00 to MICHAEL P. AND Catherine S. or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, restitution and supervision fees by 10-19-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

1.) Pre-trial incarceration credit.  
2.) Ineligible Voting notice and Acknowledgment.  
3.) Elements of the Offense.  
4.) Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief.

Defendant Joseph Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Defense requires additional time prior to Sentencing to complete discovery.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 09-29-2015 03:00 pm
date 8/5/15 from Attorney Plantinga seeking to have Br. 33 resolve this case with 14CF184.  Branch 19 allows for Br. 33 to resolve the case.

Attorney Victor E Plantinga in court, defendant Joseph James Kozlowski not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Stipulation and Order Modifying Conditions of Bail signed and filed.  Defendant in the presence of law enforcement may go to AllCity Towing for the purpose of retrieving personal property.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.

Defendant Joseph James Kozlowski in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Joanne Hardtke for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM027655  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/03/2015
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph James Kozlowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Joseph James Kozlowski in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
